verses.text: The \w burden|strong="H4853"\w* of \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w*. The \w book|strong="H5612"\w* of the \w vision|strong="H2377"\w* of \w Nahum|strong="H5151"\w* the \w Elkoshite|strong="H0512"\w*.

\w God|strong="H0410"\w* \add is\add* \w jealous|strong="H7072"\w*, and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \w revengeth|strong="H5358"\w*; the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \w revengeth|strong="H5358"\w*, and \add is\add* \w furious|strong="H1167"\w*; the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* will take \w vengeance|strong="H5358"\w* on his \w adversaries|strong="H6862"\w*, and he \w reserveth|strong="H5201"\w* \add wrath\add* for his \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*.  +  r 1.2  t God…: or, The \+nd LORD\+nd* is a jealous God, and a revenger, etc *  +  r 1.2  t is furious: Heb. that hath fury *

The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add is\add* \w slow|strong="H0750"\w* to \w anger|strong="H0639"\w*, and \w great|strong="H1419"\w* in \w power|strong="H3581"\w*, and will not at \w all|strong="H5352"\w* \w acquit|strong="H5352"\w* \add the wicked:\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath his \w way|strong="H1870"\w* in the \w whirlwind|strong="H5492"\w* and in the \w storm|strong="H8183"\w*, and the \w clouds|strong="H6051"\w* \add are\add* the \w dust|strong="H0080"\w* of his \w feet|strong="H7272"\w*.

He \w rebuketh|strong="H1605"\w* the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, and maketh it \w dry|strong="H2717"\w*, and drieth \w up|strong="H3001"\w* all the \w rivers|strong="H5104"\w*: \w Bashan|strong="H1316"\w* \w languisheth|strong="H0535"\w*, and \w Carmel|strong="H3760"\w*, and the \w flower|strong="H6525"\w* of \w Lebanon|strong="H3844"\w* \w languisheth|strong="H0535"\w*.

The \w mountains|strong="H2022"\w* \w quake|strong="H7493"\w* at him, and the \w hills|strong="H1389"\w* \w melt|strong="H4127"\w*, and the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* is \w burned|strong="H5375"\w* at his \w presence|strong="H6440"\w*, yea, the \w world|strong="H8398"\w*, and all that \w dwell|strong="H3427"\w* therein.

Who can \w stand|strong="H5975"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* his \w indignation|strong="H2195"\w*? and who can \w abide|strong="H6965"\w* in the \w fierceness|strong="H2740"\w* of his \w anger|strong="H0639"\w*? his \w fury|strong="H2534"\w* is poured \w out|strong="H5413"\w* like \w fire|strong="H0784"\w*, and the \w rocks|strong="H6697"\w* are thrown \w down|strong="H5422"\w* by him.\f + \fr 1.6 \ft abide: Heb. stand up\f*

The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w*, a strong \w hold|strong="H4581"\w* in the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of \w trouble|strong="H6869"\w*; and he \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* them that \w trust|strong="H2620"\w* in him.\f + \fr 1.7 \ft strong hold: or, strength\f*

But with an \w overrunning|strong="H5674"\w* \w flood|strong="H7858"\w* he will \w make|strong="H6213"\w* an utter \w end|strong="H3617"\w* of the \w place|strong="H4725"\w* thereof, and \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w* shall \w pursue|strong="H7291"\w* his \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*.

What do ye \w imagine|strong="H2803"\w* against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*? he will \w make|strong="H6213"\w* an utter \w end|strong="H3617"\w*: \w affliction|strong="H6869"\w* shall not rise \w up|strong="H6965"\w* the second \w time|strong="H6471"\w*.

For while \add they be\add* folden \w together|strong="H5440"\w* \add as\add* \w thorns|strong="H5518"\w*, and while they are \w drunken|strong="H5433"\w* \add as\add* \w drunkards|strong="H5435"\w*, they shall be \w devoured|strong="H0398"\w* as \w stubble|strong="H7179"\w* \w fully|strong="H4392"\w* \w dry|strong="H3002"\w*.

There is \add one\add* come \w out|strong="H3318"\w* of thee, that \w imagineth|strong="H2803"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, a \w wicked|strong="H1100"\w* \w counsellor|strong="H3289"\w*.\f + \fr 1.11 \ft a wicked…: Heb. a counsellor of Belial\f*

Thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Though \add they be\add* \w quiet|strong="H8003"\w*, and likewise \w many|strong="H7227"\w*, yet thus shall they be cut \w down|strong="H1494"\w*, when he shall pass \w through|strong="H5674"\w*. Though I have \w afflicted|strong="H6031"\w* thee, I will \w afflict|strong="H6031"\w* thee no more.\f + \fr 1.12 \ft Though…: or, If they would have been at peace, so should they have been many, and so should they have been shorn, and he should have passed away\f*\f + \fr 1.12 \ft cut down: Heb. shorn\f*
For now will I \w break|strong="H7665"\w* his \w yoke|strong="H4132"\w* from off thee, and will \w burst|strong="H5423"\w* thy \w bonds|strong="H4147"\w* in \w sunder|strong="H5423"\w*.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath given a \w commandment|strong="H6680"\w* concerning thee, \add that\add* no more of thy \w name|strong="H8034"\w* be \w sown|strong="H2232"\w*: out of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of thy \w gods|strong="H0430"\w* will I cut \w off|strong="H3772"\w* the graven \w image|strong="H6459"\w* and the molten \w image|strong="H4541"\w*: I will \w make|strong="H7760"\w* thy \w grave|strong="H6913"\w*; for thou art \w vile|strong="H7043"\w*.

Behold upon the \w mountains|strong="H2022"\w* the \w feet|strong="H7272"\w* of him that bringeth good \w tidings|strong="H1319"\w*, that \w publisheth|strong="H8085"\w* \w peace|strong="H7965"\w*! O \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, \w keep|strong="H2287"\w* thy solemn \w feasts|strong="H2282"\w*, \w perform|strong="H7999"\w* thy \w vows|strong="H5088"\w*: for the \w wicked|strong="H1100"\w* shall no \w more|strong="H3254"\w* pass \w through|strong="H5674"\w* thee; he is utterly cut \w off|strong="H3772"\w*.\f + \fr 1.15 \ft keep…: Heb. feast\f*\f + \fr 1.15 \ft the wicked: Heb. Belial\f*
